description: Partial calque of German abreagieren, from ab (“away from, off, down from”) + reagieren (“to react”).

verbs.description: abreact (third-person singular simple present abreacts, present participle abreacting, simple past and past participle abreacted)

entries.meaning: (transitive, psychoanalysis) To eliminate previously repressed emotions by reliving past experiences. [First attested in the early 20th century.]
